Class FoodItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • Item
      • FoodItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<FoodItem>

    public class FoodItem
extends Item
implements java.lang.Comparable<FoodItem>
    A food item object is an Item object that has a name, a UPC code, and a shelf life. FoodItem objects can be added to an inventory.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Item

        name, upc

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FoodItem(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String upc, int shelfLife)
      Builds a food item with the specified name, UPC code, and shelf life (in days).

    • Constructor Detail

      • FoodItem

        public FoodItem(java.lang.String name,
        java.lang.String upc,
        int shelfLife)
        Builds a food item with the specified name, UPC code, and shelf life (in days).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this food item
        upc - the UPC code printed on the packaging
        shelfLife - the number of days this item will stay fresh

      • getExpirationDate

        public java.util.GregorianCalendar getExpirationDate(java.util.GregorianCalendar dateReceived)
        Given the date the food item was received, this method will return the corresponding expiration date for this food item. The item expires on the beginning of the expiration date. This method can be used repeatedly to compute expiration dates for different manufacturing dates.
        Parameters:
        dateReceived - the day the item was received into the warehouse.
        Returns:
        the expiration date

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(FoodItem other)
        Compares this FoodItem to another FoodItem to determine relative order (for sorting food items). FoodItems are ordered first by UPC, then in the case of ties by name, and by shelf life last. Zero is returned if this food item is equal to the other food item. A negative integer is returned if this food item is less than the other food item. A positive integer is returned if this food item is greater than the other food item.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<FoodItem>
        Parameters:
        other - an item to compare this item to
        Returns:
        -1, 0, or 1 if this item is less than, equal to, or greater than the other item

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Returns true if this FoodItem represents the same food item as the other object, false otherwise.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Item
        Returns:
        true if these items represent the same food

        public int hashCode()
